description: Dive into "Capture Hua Hin: Scenic Photo Adventures" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capture Hua Hin: Scenic Photo Adventures

places.generalDescription: Cicada Market is a vibrant weekend night market in Hua Hin, offering a wide array of art, clothing, decor, and handmade goods from local vendors. It serves as a platform for artists, designers, and creators to connect with tourists and the community through cultural integration. The market features contemporary art in various forms including handmade decorative items, fashion clothes, secondhand items, and innovative SME products. Visitors can also enjoy creative activities such as workshops, exhibitions, performances, dance shows and music.

sources.snippet: An open-air weekend market that's all about arts and crafts, Cicada is popular with both Thai and foreign tourists and is particularly lively once the sun goes down. The market is divided into four sections that include decorative home items and fashion for sale, an art gallery, a massive outdoor food court, and an area dedicated to live music and shows featuring bands, dance groups, unique pantomime performances, and live DJs. What makes Cicada different from other night markets is definitely its style.
sources.shortName: 16 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Hua Hin
10 Awesome attractions in Hua Hin, Thailand

sources.snippet: The Cicada Market is a wonderful place to visit in Hua Hin because it is such a vibrant marketplace. This market is mostly about art, handmade crafts, and delicious Thai street food. It is an open-air market so make sure to wear comfortable clothing to avoid sweating too much while you take a nice stroll.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Fun & Interesting Things To Do In Hua Hin, Bangkok For The Ultimate Weekend Getaway

sources.snippet: An open-air market that sells handicrafts, small kitschy items, and products developed by independent artists, it is an integral part of any visit to Hua Hin. It is located next to Hyatt Regency in Kao Takiab and can be reached by green Saenthaew‚Äôs. The market is open only on weekends.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: Cicada Night Market ‚Äì Hunt for bargains along with some Hua Hin sightseeing in the town‚Äôs most arty market. Find paintings, sculptures and all sorts of interesting creations.
sources.siteName: V Villas Hua Hin MGallery Collection
sources.shortName: 15 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: For a dose of art and culture, Cicada Night Market is where you want to be. By night, the lights are simply mesmerising.
sources.shortName: 25 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin and Petchaburi region

places.name: Cicada Market

reviews.text:
Great medium sized market with lots of different goodies for gifts for all ages.
Live music playing all night and in a different part a juggling act especially for the kids.
Lots of fantastic food stalls with something for everyone.
We had the crispy belly pork, coconut curry, crab fried rice and stir fried vegetables. All was delicious!
Looking forward to coming again tomorrow evening to try the fish and prawns! üòã

Whilst the experience buying food was lacklustre, the kind of shopping you can do at cicada market was really unique! Many skilled craftsmen selling their crafts which you can bring home. Live music and magic show was also very lively, overall still enjoyed ourselves here :)

The market offers a variety of performances, as well as art and food for sale (though the taste might be a bit bland for a Thai like me). If you want to buy food, exchange your coupon first. I also recommend the massage shop at the very back. The masseuses are very skilled. I felt so comfortable that I fell asleep during the massage.

places.address: 83, 159 ‡∏ã‡∏≠‡∏¢ ‡∏´‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô 21, Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Huay Mongkol is a serene Buddhist temple complex located about 15 kilometers west of Hua Hin, Thailand. The highlight of the temple is its enormous statue of Luang Phor Thuad, a revered monk known for his enlightenment and miraculous powers. The statue, standing at 12 meters tall and 10 meters wide, sits atop a large mound and can be seen from afar. Visitors can climb the wide stairway to get closer to the impressive sculpture.

sources.snippet: Wat Huay Mongkol is a temple dedicated to the famous monk Luang Phor Thuad, located on the outskirts of Hua Hin. The monk who lived 400 years ago is shrouded in many stories speaking about the miracles he performed. The Huay Mongkol Temple marks a massive statue of monk Luang Phor Thuad who sits on a mound that can be accessed by a long set of stairs.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025
10 Awesome attractions in Hua Hin, Thailand

sources.snippet: The Wat Huay Mongkol is a popular tourist attraction among the Thais. The temple is located about 15 kilometers outside of Hua Hin but easy to reach by car or motorbike. For 40 Baht you can also go there with a white shared taxi (Songthaew) which you can find about 200 meters left of the train station.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: 9 Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Wat Huay Mongkol, is the enshrined place for the world‚Äôs largest statue of Luang Phor Thuad. The Buddha is mentioned in the early regional histories of southern Thailand, but his life is mainly preserved in oral traditions. Stories of the famous monk were passed on by word of mouth for centuries.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In Hua Hin

places.name: Wat Huay Mongkol

reviews.text:
A little out of the way but the expansive grounds and number of shrines, statues, and gardens makes the trip worthwhile.
We went on a Sunday and quite a lot of people there.
Has a few cafes for food and coffee in nice shaded areas.
Lake is particularly nice and can release and feed fish. Some fish are huge, so dont release your little fish there üòÖ

Nice that foreigner tax not charged for entry

The atmosphere is very shady and peaceful. The sculptures are beautiful. There is a convenience store, a cafe, and a fish feeding point. (There are no public buses at this time. I recommend driving yourself. If you take a motorcycle or Grab, have the driver wait to take you back.)

We recently visited a truly exceptional temple in Thailand, and despite the considerable walking, we found the experience immensely rewarding. The temple's beauty and intricate details were captivating, and we highly recommend it to anyone seeking a culturally enriching experience.

places.address: ‡∏ó‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏´‡∏•‡∏ß‡∏á‡∏´‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏•‡∏Ç 3219, Thap Tai, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Pran Buri Forest Park, situated just a short drive from Hua Hin, is a natural gem boasting an extensive mangrove forest and tropical woodlands. Managed by the Office of Conservation Area Management, this protected area spans 700 rai and features a tranquil white sandy beach. Visitors can explore the diverse ecosystem via raised wooden walkways that wind through the park without disturbing its delicate balance.

sources.snippet: The Pran Buri Forest Park, having a mix of mangrove, deciduous and pine trees, was established as a forest recovery project in 1982. Travellers can explore the forests by boat, go on a boardwalk over the mangrove forests, and spy on crabs and mudskippers at low tide. A watchtower along the boardwalk is perfect for catching glimpses of, among others, the four types of kingfishers at the park.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: Pranburi Forest Park, about 15 km South of Khao Takiab beach was a project initiated by Her Majesty Queen Sirikit to protect the mangrove forest. The Park with approximately 280 acres has clean white beaches. The pine forest stretches 1 km to the east of the park.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In Hua Hin

sources.snippet: A beautiful sight, one of the most tranquil things to do in Hua Hin is walking along the elevated path which offers spectacular views of the forest.
sources.siteName: V Villas Hua Hin MGallery Collection
sources.shortName: 15 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Pranburi Forest Park features Thailand‚Äôs largest mangrove forest. A wooden walkway has been constructed spanning one kilometre of the forest.
sources.shortName: 25 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin and Petchaburi region

places.name: Pran Buri Forest Park

reviews.text:
Must do! A little out of the way but 30 mins on a moped üèçÔ∏è
Boardwalk through the mangroves and you will see many amazing blue and red mud crabs ü¶Ä
We walked approximately 600m and took a small boat (450b for 1-4 pax) skippered by a gorgeous Thai lady who took us through the mangroves, out through a fishing village and to the mouth of the sea where she dropped us off on a beach which was 200m back to our starting point. Thoroughly enjoyed this experience üòé

Interesting little excursion. This park is apparently apart of conservation efforts in the area. A raised wooden path has been constructed through the mangrove to give visitors the opportunity to explore this environment. Information sign are dotted about the path to give you an idea of possible animals,insects or foliage you may see. Sadly not many of these are written in English. The route is a loop which take you back to the car park. Boat ride are available only during high season. Information center, cafe and toilets available near car park. Not push or wheelchair friendly in certain areas as trees have been left where the path was constructed.

Beautiful, clean, nice board pathway. Suitable for a narrow wheelchair, as there are some spots where a tree is in the path. Cane would be ok. It really depends on your mobility, but it is not steep or treacherous. There was 1 step up, but not a full rise, about 5 inches. It's pretty far down the path, so you could go and turn around and not miss a whole lot. It's quite humid, bring water. No restrooms along the path. Across the street is a little stand with snacks & beverages. Absolutely worth the trip.

places.address: Pak Nam Pran, Pran Buri District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77220, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Hua Hin Night Market is a vibrant and bustling traditional marketplace located in the heart of central Hua Hin. The market comes alive in the evening, offering a wide array of goods from souvenirs, clothing, and crafts to DVDs.

sources.snippet: No matter how much upscale shopping you do in Thailand, nothing beats the authentic feel of a local night market ‚Äì a chance to soak up the atmosphere and experience real Thai market culture. Night markets often have no rhyme or reason in Thailand, and Hua Hin's night market is no exception. Here, you'll find arts and crafts next to cheap snacks (don't be too shocked at the deep-fried insect snacks for sale) and stalls offering apparel.
sources.shortName: 16 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Hua Hin's central market is a favorite of locals and tourists alike; this night market starts from Petchkasem Road, up to the railway line. Delicious food cooked right in front of your eyes can be sampled at the various stalls at the market. In addition, vendors can be found selling their small souvenirs and goods at stalls at affordable prices.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: This vibrant market comes alive every evening in the heart of Hua Hin. It‚Äôs a great place to shop for local handicrafts, and souvenirs, and enjoy a wide range of street food. The market is a bustling spot that captures the essence of Hua Hin‚Äôs local culture.
sources.shortName: Recommendation for Hua Hin & Cha-am Attractions: Where to visit in Hua Hin & Cha-am

sources.snippet: Nothings say a weekend getaway like a trip to a night market. And, the good news is that the Hua Hin Night Market is vibrant, awesome and a must-visit!. Prepare to feast away and enjoy so many delicious Thai street food.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Fun & Interesting Things To Do In Hua Hin, Bangkok For The Ultimate Weekend Getaway

sources.snippet: A highlight for many visitors is the night market of Hua Hin. Every evening in the center of Hua Hin along the Soi 72 there are countless stalls with souvenirs and food. The night market starts at 5.00 P.M.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: 9 Things to Do in Hua Hin
10 Awesome attractions in Hua Hin, Thailand

places.name: Hua Hin Night Market

reviews.text: Hua Hin main night Market. Runs every night. Has many shops for local goods and clothes along side many food stands and stalls. Large variety of seafood restaurants cooking out front and then you can sit at the restaurant. Very close by it's connected by an alley to the Patio which is a small square with tables, food and music as well. It's great to walk around and enjoy the vibe and then stop to have a bite to eat here and there. Easy to get to as the green Baht bus ends at the market. They have everything from savory to sweet, pizza to ice cream. You will not leave hungry. We went several times during our stay and never ate the same thing twice!!!

This market is big and offers a lot. Lots of food and the prices are reasonable. I ate ribs and sticky rice for 100b which was tasty. The fried mussels for 50b with sauce was a tasty good deal. They also sell souvenirs and clothing. There are several table to sit and eat plus a few 7/11 around. Lots of fresh seafood available grilling of however you like. Recommended
Definitely a hot spot for tourists. Prices are a bit higher in the area but you can find all kinds of things here from food to souvenirs. It's not too crowded and food selections are decent.

places.address: ‡∏ã, Hua Hin 72, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Tham Khao Tao, located near Suan Son beach in the village of Baan Khao Tao, is a serene and colorful temple complex. The site features vibrant shrines and Buddhist statues within a concrete cave, as well as a small real cave. Visitors can climb the stairs to reach a large standing Buddha overlooking the village. Situated at the coast south of Hua Hin, this temple offers a unique experience with few non-Asian visitors, making it an authentic cultural encounter.

sources.snippet: Another place of interest is the Wat Tham Khao Tao in the village of Khao Tao directly at the coast, a few kilometers south of Hua Hin. When you visit this temple, you will be most likely the only non-Asian visitor. That‚Äôs why the people are still pleased to see some foreign visitors.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: 9 Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Wat Tham Khao Tao: Perched atop the mountain, Wat Khao Tao temple adds cultural flair and intricate architectural details to your photos. Talk about stunning!
sources.shortName: Top Spots for Photos & Family Fun

places.name: Wat Tham Khao Tao

reviews.text: Easily accessible and a lot bigger than expected! Beautiful area with amazing views at the top. Tip: afterwards have a leisurely stroll around the lake.

It's a beautiful place with a lot of points checked: a temple, some walkable, yet a little challenging trails, views of the big water and city from above, a huge golden Buddha on the top of the hill...

Just note that most of the structure that looks like rock if artificial, which significantly de-values the atmosphere and its integrity. Simply put, it feels fake at times.

Still worth visiting!

Little Buddhist temple on hill top. There's lots of Buddhist duties statue to check out. Because the temple was built on the moutain top, the scenery overlooking the beach is absolutely breathtaking. Some walkways can be a little run down but all are easily accessible. There's lots of English direction to help visitors

places.address: FX4J+Q25, Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Rajabhakti Park, situated on Phetkasem Road in Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan Province, is a historical park paying homage to the royal lineage of Thailand. The park showcases seven striking bronze statues of revered Thai kings from different periods in history.

sources.snippet: The Rajabhakti Park is located on the way between Hua Hin and Khao Tao and was built to honor the 7 great kings of Siam. The 7 pictured kings are the following: King Ramkhamhaeng, King Naresuan, King Narai, King Taksin, King Buddha Yodfa Chulaloke, King Mongkut and King Chulalongkorn. These were the kings from the Sukhothai period to the Rattanakosin period.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: 9 Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Hua Hin‚Äôs Rajabhakti Park is a tribute to the royal dynasties of Thailand. It honors Thai kings from the Sukhothai period to the current Chakri Dynasty. The park is dominated by bronze statues of seven notable kings.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025

places.name: Rajabhakti Park

reviews.text: Amazing statues and parade square dedicated to past kings of thailand.  Detail and size of statuses as well as the setting with hills in background is a sight to see. No fees, however there are donation boxes prior to getting onto the complimentary  shuttle busses which take you from the shop area to parade square. Some small stalls selling memorabilia at bus drop off and pick op point. Nice beach located over the road with deck chairs etc 100 bt fir the day .

Recommend to come in the morning or later near to 6pm when the Sun is not so hot as there is no shelter.
Majestic statue of Thailand ancient kings and warriors.
There is a horse with an army boy giving visitors free photo taking and a hop to sit on it just for photo taking.
Overall, it is worth to visit if you have your own transportation like a rental motorcycle or car.

Outstanding historical side with 7 of the previous Kings of a Thailand. Very impressive and very well
Maintained. Entrance fee is a  voluntary donation and the local shuttle busses make it very comfortable

places.address: FXX8+H8H, 8 Phet Kasem Rd, Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Hua Hin Artists Village (Baan Sillapin) is a unique art space located in Prachuap Khiri Khan province, Central Thailand. It offers a collection of art galleries, studios, an open-air cafe, and craft workshops hosting classes. Visitors can immerse themselves in a lyrical environment and even create their own creative products by hand.

sources.snippet: Located just a few miles from the energetic beaches is the quiet, tranquil oasis that is Hua Hin Artists Village, also known as Baan Sillapin. One of the original arts centers in Hua Hin, this vibrant collective sits shrouded in beautiful green plants, perched on the edge of a small canal. The space includes several large galleries of art and antiques, as well as actual artists' studios, where projects are constantly being dreamt up and actualized.
sources.shortName: 16 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Hua Hin Artists Village, better known as Baan Sillapin, is an excellent art-themed retreat just 5km away from the main center. There are 15 art families in the village; most have their traditional studios on the site. The artworks on exhibition in these studios include clay sculptures, paintings, woodcarving, photography, pencil sketches, watercolor, oil painting, jewelry, and handicraft items.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: You will experience Thai art first hand, while observing and interacting with the nineteen different in-house artists: painters, sculptors, and moulders.
sources.shortName: 25 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin and Petchaburi region

places.name: Hua Hin Artists Village (Baan Sillapin)

reviews.text: I really enjoyed visiting The Artists Village - it was filled with beautiful, vintage-style paintings that reflected refined artistic taste. The entrance fee was 80 baht, which is a symbolic amount, and as I understood, it helps support the maintenance and care of the place - something I truly appreciate. Unfortunately, the artworks were beyond my budget, but as an art lover, simply viewing them was a joy. I bought a small souvenir from outside: a watercolor painting of Hua Hin, as a lovely keepsake from this charming place.

I really enjoyed my time at Hua Hin Artist Village. It is a peaceful and creative place, full of colors and good energy. There are many beautiful paintings and sculptures by Thai artists. I also saw some artists working in their studios, which was very interesting. The place is quiet and not too crowded, so I could relax and take my time.

There is a small caf√© where I had coffee and enjoyed the view. I also joined a painting workshop, and it was fun, even for someone like me who is not very good at art. The staff were kind and helpful.

The location is a bit outside the city, but it's easy to get there by tuk-tuk. If you like art and want something different in Hua Hin, I recommend this place.

I've been coming to Hua Hin a few years now and always make a point of visiting the Artist Village. Such a creative and fun place to visit - every way you turn there are new, beautiful and thought provoking things to discover - whether they are paintings, sculptures, or antique furniture. Far more interesting than a regular art gallery and just an amazing space to spend time in.

places.address: 82, Hin Lek Fai, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Memory House Cafe in Hua Hin is a must-visit for cafe enthusiasts. The cafe's picturesque setting features a stunning field of vibrant grasses and offers breathtaking views of the Hua Hin hill, making it an Instagram-worthy spot. Its European suburban warehouse-style decor adds to its charm, and its location at the edge of Khao Tao reservoir provides a serene natural ambiance for visitors to enjoy delicious drinks.

sources.snippet: If you are an avid cafe hopper, certainly, you may have heard of the Memory House Cafe in Hua Hin. The cafe is known for its beautiful field of tall multi-coloured grasses which teleports you to an otherly rainbow world. This sanctuary also overlooks a beautiful Hua Hin hill, which further adds to its title as the most instagrammable cafe.
sources.shortName: Top 5 must-visit cafes in Hua Hin 2022

sources.snippet: Possibly the most Instagram-famous cafe on our list, Memory House is an avid Instagrammers heaven. The white country-style house sits amidst a wheat field, providing a rustic flair for cafe-goers. There are plenty of photogenic spots here, be it in the colourful fields, at the white wooden houses, or inside the cafe itself.
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable cafes to check out in Hua Hin
Instagrammable Cafes In Hua Hin That Should Be On Your List

places.name: Memory House Cafe

reviews.text: Small area but just simply stunning !! If you love to take photos, you will definitely love this place!! Is photo spot everywhere.

The place very much like a place solely designed for taking photos. The drinks were awesome. The frappacinno and the Blue soda with bear jelly was out of this world. Very good taste and looks exquisite and exceptional. Highly recommend to come if you have 1 hour or so spare. It is about 30mins away from Hua Hin town but well worth the ride out.

A chic cafe by the reservoir with stunning decorations and tons of photo spots.
The 50 baht entrance fee can be used as a discount on drinks or cakes.
Personally, the drinks aren't particularly impressive as the menu book, but the beautiful setup and relaxing vibe make it worth the visit.
It's just 30 min far from Hua Hin if u take bike.
There are both open-air seats and air-conditioned chalets, free Wi-Fi, and a large parking area. Perfect for a photo day out, even if the menu isn't the highlight.

places.address: 43, 56 ‡∏ã‡∏≠‡∏¢ ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏´‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏•‡πÄ‡∏•‡∏à‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏Å, Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Hua Hin Beach is a popular destination along the Gulf of Thailand, offering clear waters and soft, powdery sand. It's known for its unmatched Thai hospitality and a wide range of exciting activities. The area is not as crowded as other tourist spots, making it perfect for a leisurely day by the sea. Visitors can enjoy water sports like kiteboarding and kitesurfing due to consistent winds. The beach also boasts lovely beachfront hotels with direct access or public areas for relaxation.

sources.shortName: 10 Awesome attractions in Hua Hin, Thailand

sources.snippet: The almost 8 kilometers long beach of Hua Hin is one of the most beautiful beaches of the Thai mainland. Fine white and soft sand. Sometimes there are sunbeds offered for visitors, especially at the northern end, but it‚Äôs never too crowded at the beach.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: 9 Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Hua Don Beach, as known as South of Takiab beach, is next to Pattaya-Huahin ferry terminal. Another beauty of Hua Don beach, that people love taking photogrphy, is the scene when fishing boats sail back to the village while the sun is rising.
sources.siteName: G Hua Hin Resort and Mall
sources.shortName: 6 Places to Watch the Sunrise in Hua Hin Beach

sources.snippet: Last but not the least, your weekend getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without a trip to Hua Hin Beach. Of white sandy beaches, clear blue sky and salty air, this beach is beautiful as it as relaxing. Plus, you can even ride horses here!
sources.shortName: Top 10 Fun & Interesting Things To Do In Hua Hin, Bangkok For The Ultimate Weekend Getaway

sources.snippet: Hua Don Beach, or South of Takiab beach, offers a charming scene of fishing boats sailing back to the village during sunrise. You can travel via the Pattaya-Huahin ferry terminal to get to this lovely beach.
sources.shortName: 7 Stunning Places Perfect for Sunrise-Watching in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Beach: Picture-perfect Khao Tao beach boasts soft sand and shallow waters, making it a safe and fun playground for the little ones to get candid shots of your kids enjoying the water.
sources.shortName: Top Spots for Photos & Family Fun

places.name: Hua Hin Beach

reviews.text: Very nice beach with warm waters to swim. Small shops on the way to the beach. Kids and adults had a good time walking along the water and exploring small animals. There were plenty of horse-riding options available at a charge of 250-300 per horse.

Hua Hin Beach is a beautiful place to watch the sunrise. The beach faces east, so the sun rises directly over the sea. In the early morning, the sky changes color-orange, pink, and gold. The beach is quiet, with only a few people walking or monks collecting alms. The sand is soft, and the sound of waves is peaceful. It is a perfect time to relax and enjoy nature.

A good spot to see the sunrise is in front of Centara Grand Beach Resort. This area has rocks and coconut trees, making the view more special.  Another nice place is Khao Takiab Beach, which is quieter and has a clear view of the sunrise.  Ôøº Ôøº

If you visit Hua Hin, I recommend waking up early to see the sunrise. It is a peaceful and beautiful experience that you will remember.

Went here and it having food festival..

Berry crowded.. many food and drink stalls..

Music..

Water fountain and lights in the night..

I saw many family here also lovers..

Everyone relaxing and enjoying the views and vibes..

So happy to feel this beach with the festival

U can find temples and monkeys too

Aaaah elephant village too

sources.snippet: If you are interested in witnessing an incredible sunrise but hate waking up early, then Hua Hin Queen‚Äôs Park may be the perfect spot for you. Here, you don‚Äôt have to climb hundreds of steps or hike mountains first thing in the morning. All you need to do is walk, bike, or ride public transportation to the park.
sources.shortName: 7 Stunning Places Perfect for Sunrise-Watching in Hua Hin

places.name: Queens Park 19 rai

reviews.text:
Small but beautiful park by the water.
The people doing landscaping are making it even more beautiful. It was a very windy day so we were no able to go in the water.
Here is ample seating, shaded and covered.
And a workout/exercise area too.
There is a bathroom, kids play area, and some food vendors right there.
Lots of parking.
Overall a beautiful place and great playground for kids. There was a live music too. The breezy seaview was awesome to just sit and chill.

Cool playground with a variety of slides, swings, climbing structures. Quite large and rare for Hua Hin.

The playground is not covered in sand or protective rubber surface, though, so be mindful of small sharp rocks under the small feet or hard ground under the swings.

Our little one appreciated the rubber tracks that went through the park - great opportunity to master those cycling or balance bike skills.

Atmosphere in the park itself, especially in the evening, is quite nice, with a live performance, some food and drinks sold on the premises plus view and access to the open water.

Recommended.

places.address: JX23+GV2, Hua Hin, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Khao Tao Beach offers a picturesque view of the fisherman's village, Khao Tao Temple, Lion Island, Sadao Island, and Keenok Island. There is a local legend about monks from Wat Tham Khao Tao checking for sharks every morning. The beach is spacious with stunning views of the city and the temple. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful walk during sunset while watching the fishing fleet.

sources.snippet: Khao Tao Beach is a tranquil place that provides gorgeous views of fishermen‚Äôs villages, Keenok Island, Khao Tao Temple, Lion Island, and Sadao Island. It is easily accessible from Hua Hin City.
sources.shortName: 7 Stunning Places Perfect for Sunrise-Watching in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Moreover, from this spot you are going to see fishermen‚Äôs village, Khao Tao Temple, Lion Island, Sadao Island, and Keenok Island.
sources.siteName: G Hua Hin Resort and Mall
sources.shortName: 6 Places to Watch the Sunrise in Hua Hin Beach

places.name: Khao Tao Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful, tranquil beach that you can almost have all to yourself. Lacks chairs and umbrella fysa.

Nice beach, not too busy
Recommended!

Hidden Gem of Tranquility üêüü™∏ü™ºüêö

It's a safe and calm environment, perfect for those who want to escape the crowds and reconnect with nature.
Highly recommended for anyone craving solitude and the untouched beauty of the seaside-definitely a hidden gem that deserves more love.
The surroundings are incredibly clean, and the water is crystal clear-ideal for a relaxing stroll or simply enjoying the sound of gentle waves.
Unlike the often-crowded Hua Hin or Cha-Am, this spot offers a serene and quiet atmosphere with very few visitors.
There are no noisy vendors or other water sport activities here, only paragliding and just a few local fishery boats in the distance, adding a touch of authenticity to the coastal experience.

places.address: Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Khao Takiap, also known as the 'Temple on the Hill,' is a tranquil Buddhist temple situated just outside Hua Hin, Thailand. It features a lengthy stairway leading to a vibrant shrine and offers picturesque views of the sea. The temple is perched atop a hill and provides breathtaking panoramic vistas of the coastline and its surroundings. At the summit, visitors are welcomed by a majestic golden Buddha statue overlooking the sea, representing tranquility and safety.

sources.snippet: Perched on 272m Chopstick Hill jutting out into the Gulf of Thailand, Wat Khao Takiap is a magnificent Buddhist temple. The shrine is dedicated to Guan Yin, the Boddhisattva of mercy and compassion who owns a thousand arms. The temple overlooks the Gulf of Thailand and offers a magnificent vista as far as Cha-Am Beach in the distance.
sources.shortName: 32 Things to do in Hua Hin Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: Wat Khao Takiap, which is also known as the Chopsticks Hill, is located at the southern end of Hua Hin Beach. To get to the top of this amazing spot, you can climb a winding stairway. It offers an overlooking view of the breathtaking coast and an interesting sight of fishing boats heading out for the day during sunrise.
sources.shortName: 7 Stunning Places Perfect for Sunrise-Watching in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: At the southern end of the Hua Hin Beach in the town of Khao Takiab you can find the popular Chopstick Hill, also known as Monkey Mountain. On top you will find the Wat Khao Takiab. But to get there you will have to climb about 100 steps and pass lots of curious monkeys.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: 9 Things to Do in Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Wat Khao Takiab: This temple, situated on a mountain, provides a tranquil setting to watch the sunset. Overlooking Khao Takiab Beach, the changing colors of the sky here are a natural wonder.
sources.siteName: Hua Hin Today - Your Premier Source for News, Reports, Events, and Information in Hua Hin
sources.shortName: Discover romantic sunset spots for Valentine's Day in Hua Hin - Hua Hin Today
25 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin and Petchaburi region

places.name: Wat Khao Takiap

reviews.text: There is some unusual quietness: a lot of birds are flying over the top of the hill but they are almost completely soundless which creates a feeling of something unreal: they fly in masses over the head but with no any air sliding sounds or even screams. The place is really magic. Beware of monkeys: I think, the total population is over a hundred there. Not that I have seen any of them behaving aggressively with humans but being surrounded by them moving to and fro so close is not a comfortable feeling. One more piece of advice is to see that temple from the seaside by kayaking: it feels absolutely cinematic and unreal.

Monkey mountain is no misnomer, there were indeed monkeys and plenty of them. It's quite a hill, so we took a taxi with Bolt up. The view is excellent at sunset and there are almost no tourists at this time either, but the temple was shut when we visited. We came for the view and monkeys and left very satisfied, taking a stroll down the hill to the restaurants at the foot of the hill serving fresh seafood.
Walkable distance from Hua Hin beach but could be tiring due to steep hill. Quiet but full of monkeys so be careful not to provoke or feed them. Parking is available but limited.

places.address: 123, 55 Nong Kae-Takiap, Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the KaengKrachan National Park, about 60 km west of Hua Hin, Pa La-U Waterfall offers a picturesque setting with its 16 cascades and ancient forest teeming with rare wildlife. Visitors can embark on moderate to challenging hikes through unspoiled rainforest to reach the waterfall, where they can marvel at the natural beauty and take a refreshing dip in pools filled with wild carp fish.

sources.snippet: Pa La-U Waterfall in Kaeng Krachan National Park, a 1000-year old forest is the largest national park of Thailand. It is about 65 km West of Hua Hin & near to the border with Burma. A 16-tiered waterfalllocated in the verdant forest area of Kaeng Krachan National Park where various kinds of birds and butterflies are found.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In Hua Hin

sources.snippet: Pala-U Waterfall ‚Äì One of the largest waterfalls in the country and definitely one of the most refreshing things to see in Hua Hin.
sources.siteName: V Villas Hua Hin MGallery Collection
sources.shortName: 15 out-of-the-ordinary things to do in Hua Hin

places.name: Pa La-U Waterfall, Kaen Krachan National Park

reviews.text:
A beautiful spot in Kaeng Krachan National Park near the Burma border in Thailand! Tourists can only hike up to level 5 of the waterfall now because many get stuck on the trail from level 6 to 15, which was disappointing since I wanted to go further.

That said, We spent a long time swimming in the amazing deep water at level 5. There were so many fish to feed and butterflies in every color imaginable ‚Äì a magical experience! The hike up took around 30 minutes and was quite easy. Definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful waterfalls with 5 levels that are available for tourists. In total the waterfalls have 15 levels which you can see on a map at the entrance.  You can also feed fish here with food that can be bought for 10Baht at the entrance. In addition they have a small shop to buy refreshment and snacks.  If you are planning to make your way up to level 5 make sure you bring enough water as it is a quite exhausting way.  You can also swim here if you want. The water is cool and refreshing.
Food is not allowed after level  1 so make sure you eat before you go further.  There is a checkpoint after level 1 where you have to deposit your food to make sure no food goes further than level 1 but you are allowed to bring water.
Entrance fee for adult foreigners is 300 Baht and for kids 150 Baht. For thai nationals it is 60 Baht and 30 Baht for kids. Vehicles are 30 Baht and motorcycles 20 Baht

We loved it!! Total hike to top and back was about 3.5 km, and we spent 2.5 hours.  The trail is not simply walking - it involves quite a bit of climbing, which we enjoyed.  Lots of fish in the water, but they avoid us when we enter the water.  The five levels of the waterfall have many places to wade in water or just sit and relax (but no food allowed).  We went on a Saturday (in November) but it was not crowded.

places.address: GFQ7+6CV, Huai Sat Yai, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Top Seacret Beach Cafe is a charming spot with pink parasols that stand out against the blue sea, offering stunning views and delicious food and drinks. Located at soi hua hin 75/2, it's easily accessible with helpful security guards to guide you. The cafe features a variety of food and drink options, served by accommodating staff in a Bali-style 2-story bungalow with beachfront, garden, and indoor seating.

sources.snippet: Are you looking to update your Instagram feed with the most stunning pictures?. The Top Seacret Beach Cafe is the place to go. The seaside cafe has a boho and spring feel to it, as well as a plethora of gorgeous shooting locations.
sources.shortName: Top 5 must-visit cafes in Hua Hin 2022

places.name: Top Seacret Beach Cafe

reviews.text: Great restaurant on the beach that is very cool with a great outdoor setting. Hidden away from the main road, but right on the beach. The area is excellent and a great atmosphere with lots of tables on the grass and cool beanbags on the deck area. The food was really tasty and most dishes between 100B to 250B. Great value and really good quality food ( not huge serves, but great value for money). Only disappointment is the prices of drinks. A small local beer is 150B ( usually around 80 to 90B) and all other drinks also expensive. They do a happy hour from 4 to 6pm with Buy 1 and get 1 free so maybe they have these expensive prices just for Happy Hour üòî.  So not somewhere you can relax on the beanbags and have 3 or 4 drinks, but definitely worth it for the great food and outdoor settings. Friendly staff, but not table service so don't expect it.

*sea view- chill place*

This place has a beautiful garden and sea view specially on sunsetüçÄ.
I totally recommend it for chill and enjoy the view , read a book.
The staff was nice , I don't have complaints.

Be aware of the mosquitos, use a repellent and you will be fine.

I didn't try the food, but I saw a lot of options on the menu.

I suggest they replace the plastic cups for glass or for another environment  friendly material, specially if we drink inside the place.

Food was just okay, but expensive. You pay for the view and cute decor.  Customer service needs improvement - serve customers in the order they arrive, prioritizing the first customer in line. The servers need to have better communication & friendlier attitude. All the bean bag chairs were taken around 5 pm. Not enough outdoor tables.

places.address: 155 Hua Hin 75/2 Alley, Hua Hin, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77110, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Ch√°gu«én Caf√© is a modern Chinese teahouse located near the Pranburi Old Market. The caf√© offers a variety of dim sum and tea, with the option to indulge in animal-shaped steamed buns for an extra special treat. The Chinese-inspired interiors provide plenty of photo opportunities, making it a popular spot for social media enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: The modern Chinese teahouse is located near the Pranburi Old Market and serves up an array of dim sum and tea. You‚Äôll find plenty to ‚Äògram within the Chinese-inspired interiors, but if you‚Äôre looking for something a little extra, we recommend ordering the animal-shaped steamed buns especially. Address: Amphoe Pranburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan, Thailand
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Cafes In Hua Hin That Should Be On Your List

sources.snippet: Whilst many of the hotels in Hua Hin boast very nice cafes, Siam Bakery is a popular one in particular. Located at the entrance of the Hua Hin Marriott Resort & Spa, you don‚Äôt even have to step into the main hotel premises to enjoy an afternoon here. Between pastries and good coffee, it‚Äôs a charming and classic cafe ambience.
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable cafes to check out in Hua Hin

reviews.text: A surprising nice Dim sum restaurant in the old Pranburi quarter close to the rail station.  Good food and tea drinks at affordable price. Wise interior decoration and friendly service. Parking available on the roadside. This one is worth visiting.

Fantastic food and ambience!
Loved everything about it and will be coming soon.
Their homemade sauces & presentation was 5 star ‚≠ê

Wow, this place was a great find. Just 20 minutes from Hua Hin, it's tucked away on a small street that also comes alive with a weekend market.
The restaurant itself is filled with eye-catching murals, detailed models, and well-displayed historical items that give it a unique charm.
The food was okay-not the main reason we'd return. But the atmosphere was incredibly relaxing, and the coffee? Absolutely fantastic

places.address: 279-281, Pran Buri District, Prachuap Khiri Khan 77120, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Pran Buri Dam is a picturesque earth dam that creates a vast reservoir by blocking the Pranburi River. Spanning 1,500 meters, it offers breathtaking natural surroundings and leisure opportunities such as walking and cycling with panoramic views. The area is tranquil, attracting few visitors except for local fishermen. It's ideal for activities like paddle boarding and enjoying the water. Access points around the lake allow entry for water-based activities.

sources.snippet: Pranburi Dam: Offering a beautiful landscape view, the sunset over Pranburi Dam, set against a mountainous backdrop, is a sight to behold. The dam‚Äôs serene environment makes it an ideal spot for couples seeking a peaceful retreat.
sources.siteName: Hua Hin Today - Your Premier Source for News, Reports, Events, and Information in Hua Hin
sources.shortName: Discover romantic sunset spots for Valentine's Day in Hua Hin - Hua Hin Today

places.name: Pran Buri Dam

reviews.text: Took a 2-hour drive from Hua Hin to Pranburi Dam Lake via Taweekarn Farm, Pala U. A beautifully scenic drive up the 3218 road before turning off to Tawekarn Farm for a very pleasant lunch break at their wonderful restaurant.  From there, we took the back dirt road through the mountains to the backside of the lake. I was in an old Vios saloon, and the road presented no problems. Amazing mountain views equal to those at the border on Suan Peung. 11 am thu 4.30 pm ... a very pleasant Sunday jaunt.
On one of the banks of this reservoir there's a big uninhabited ground where you can stop by on your RV or car or bike.  The view is scenic.
Great ride up to the dam then beautiful views and quite and peaceful ‚úåÔ∏è

places.address: ‡∏µ, Tambon Khao Chao, Pran Buri District, Chang Wat Prachuap Khiri Khan 77120, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Khao Tao is a tranquil coastal village in Thailand, known for its serene beaches and traditional fishing atmosphere. The area features the beautiful Sai Noi Beach, offering a more peaceful escape from the crowds. Visitors can also explore the Khao Tao Temple with stunning mountain views and the bay at Khao Tao (Turtle Hill) for lovely vistas over the Hua Hin coastline.

sources.snippet: Variety of Scenery: Khao Tao offers a mix of landscapes, giving you plenty of options for your photoshoot. We get the beach, the sea, a mountain backdrop, village life, a reservoir, and temples‚Äîpretty much everything you could ask for!
sources.shortName: Top Spots for Photos & Family Fun

sources.snippet: Khao Tao Lake: A unique place to watch the sunset‚Äôs colors reflect over the lake. For the more adventurous, a walk up the mountain offers even more stunning views.
sources.siteName: Hua Hin Today - Your Premier Source for News, Reports, Events, and Information in Hua Hin
sources.shortName: Discover romantic sunset spots for Valentine's Day in Hua Hin - Hua Hin Today

places.name: Khao Tao

reviews.text: Just 15km from Hua Hin going South. You can wonder around the Reservoir or sample the street food down by the temple. Enter the temple along the fishing jetty and climb up to the large golden Buddha. You can get access to the beach by climbing the path over the rocks

Pretty unique set up for the temple. The view is amazing, the temple location is excellent. However, you can tell that it's not been well maintain which is not a bad thing. I only wish they built less ugly concert fake cave structures. Because the nature is so magnificent, it really doesn't need those ugly man made structures. However, the. Temple itself is absolutely beautiful. I also love the small fish village right by it.

Off DPT. Prachuap Khiri khan 2002 road, there's a small road up a hill¬†leading to Chao Mae Tuptim Thong Shrine, Racer Marina Hua hin and Pranburi Forest Park.¬† About halfway to the shrine, there's a shortcut with a sign reading "Pranburi Forest Park".¬† This small dirt road runs through a hilly jungle for a distance of about a couple of kilometers and ends near Bella Costa Hua Hin.¬† We decided to drive along it to get to the park.¬† It was all green all the way with brush and trees.¬† Surprisingly, we saw a peafowl and her 2 babies looking for food along it.¬† Then again, 2 more young peacocks and¬†a couple of peafowls foraging in the brush!¬† We have no idea how they are raised or wild ones, but it's a pleasant surprise to see them.

places.address: Nong Kae, Hua Hin District, Prachuap Khiri Khan, Thailand
